page.title: 01A STOTTESDON GAZETTEER
page.content: This is a{rural area}with a small village in the S.E. corner of the block. There is a shop, P.O., School, 2 public houses, & a church. { {Nearest towns }to Stottesdon are: Cleobury Mortimer 5mls, Bridgnorth 10 mls, Bewdley 10 mls, Ludlow 10 mls, Kidderminster 13 mls, Shrewsbury & Birmingham 30 mls. {The land}is a plateau dissected by many small, steep sided water courses, resulting in steep gradients on some of the narrow, winding roads. The clay soil is cultivated in small fields, bounded by hedgerows in which grow mature trees. There are also plantations of conifers usually underplanted with deciduous saplings. Most farmhouses have an ancient orchard no longer managed as such. There are trees everywhere, though not in concentrated areas of woodland.
